title: Editorial Guidelines
subtitle: How we create quality, reliable content

contentCreation.heading: Content Creation Process
contentCreation.intro: All exercises and worksheets on this site are carefully created by a team committed to educational quality:
contentCreation.item1: Exercises are aligned with elementary school math curriculum standards
contentCreation.item2: Difficulty levels are appropriately graded by age and learning stage
contentCreation.item3: Each exercise type is reviewed for clarity and mathematical accuracy
contentCreation.item4: We stay updated on new teaching methods and incorporate them into our content

sources.heading: Sources & Verification
sources.item3: Current pedagogical research in math education
sources.item4: Feedback from teachers and parents using the site

corrections.heading: Corrections Policy
corrections.intro: We are committed to accuracy and transparency:
corrections.item1: Errors are corrected immediately upon discovery
corrections.item2: We encourage users to report mistakes through our contact form
corrections.item3: Significant updates are documented and published
corrections.item4: We regularly review existing content for accuracy and relevance

curriculum.heading: Curriculum Alignment
curriculum.intro: Our exercises cover core curriculum topics:
curriculum.item1: Addition and Subtraction - numbers up to 1,000,000
curriculum.item2: Multiplication and Division - times tables and complex calculations
curriculum.item3: Fractions - adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing fractions
curriculum.item4: Percentages - calculating percentages and applied problems
curriculum.item6: Measurement units - conversions and word problems

contact.heading: Questions & Feedback
contact.text: Have a question about our content or a suggestion for improvement? We'd love to hear from you!
